question: [File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: progress update task] [Durability] Line 245 writes without fsync - can OS caching cause progress loss on power failure? (High)
[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validation progress task] [Write failure] Line 376 writes progress but only logs context

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::new()] [Permission check] Progress file operations lack permission validation - can unprivileged attackers modify progress files in shared environments? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::validate()] [Read error handling] Lines 307-314 treat read errors as version 0 - can attackers exploit this to force re-validation from genesis? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::new()] [gRPC client creation] Line 106 creates grpc_client - does it validate TLS certificates, or can MITM attacks inject malicious transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::new()] [Request parameters] Lines 107-110 create request - can attacker-controlled starting_version cause the fullnode to respond with invalid data? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Stream take] Line 153 takes ownership of grpc_stream - can stream be taken multiple times causing use-after-move panics? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Frame expectation] Lines 154-158 expect first frame - can delayed or reordered network packets cause incorrect frame processing? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Status type check] Line 162 checks StatusType::Init - are there timing windows where non-Init status could be valid, causing false rejections? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Stream loop] Lines 265-302 iterate stream indefinitely - can slow or stalled streams cause the backfiller to hang without timeout? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Error panic] Line 272 panics on stream error - does this prevent implementing retry logic for transient network failures? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Response unwrap] Line 276 unwraps response - can malicious or buggy fullnode send responses without response field to crash backfiller? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Version ordering] Line 281 assumes transactions arrive in order - can out-of-order delivery from network reordering corrupt the transactions_buffer? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill async task] [Batch size validation] Line 189 requires exactly 1000 transactions - can attackers craft batches with 1000 invalid transactions to bypass quantity check while corrupting data quality? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill async task] [Version alignment] Line 191 requires version % 1000 == 0 - can misaligned but sequential versions bypass both checks causing fragmented storage? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill async task] [Continuity validation] Lines 194-199 validate version continuity - does this check transaction content integrity, or only version numbers? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill async task] [No signature check] Transaction validation lacks signature verification - can attackers inject unsigned or incorrectly signed transactions into file storage? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill async task] [No hash verification] No Merkle root or transaction hash validation - can malicious fullnode provide fabricated transactions? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: backfill async task] [Upload trust] Line 204-207 uploads without verifying success - can partial uploads corrupt file store without detection? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate async task] [Single transaction fetch] Line 343 fetches with count=1 - does this actually validate all 1000 transactions in each batch? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: validate async task] [Version-only validation] Lines 344-346 only check version numbers - does this validate transaction content, signatures, or state transitions? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::new()] [Chain ID timing] Line 119 checks chain_id after metadata fetch - can race conditions between check and usage allow chain ID changes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Transaction deduplication] Line 283 inserts by version - can duplicate versions overwrite valid transactions with invalid ones? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Buffer unbounded] Line 146 creates BTreeMap without size limit - can attacker-controlled fullnode send unlimited partial batches to exhaust memory? (High)

[File: aptos-core/ecosystem/indexer-grpc/indexer-grpc-file-store-backfiller/src/processor.rs] [Function: Processor::backfill()] [Task count] Lines 173-216 spawn backfill_processing_task_count tasks - can extremely high config values (e.g., 10000) exhaust system resources? (High)
